Code of Conduct

The following guidelines are not a legal document, and final interpretation is up to the governing body of bytetower.social. These guidelines are here to provide you with an insight into the site and moderation policies because all members are guests here:

  1. All users, local and remote, are expected to adhere to the following principles:

    1. If you post others' work, you must credit the original artist/author, and must include some form of analysis or opinion on the work posted. Pure reposting of other people's work is not permitted.

    2. Posting the same or similar content on multiple different instances (Fediverse servers) in order to spam local and/or federated timelines is not permitted.

    3. Respect other users' boundaries. Be respectful and sincerely apologize if someone informs you that a boundary has been crossed. Give people space if you accidentally push past a boundary.

    4. If you find yourself involved in a conflict and are worried about the situation escalating, contact your moderation team.

    5. Tag sensitive content such as violence/blood, NSFW content, and other potentially upsetting or triggering topics and hide them under a Content Warning (CW). CW is a big part of the culture of the Fediverse, and CW potentially upsetting content is how we keep our community and the wider Fediverse safe and supportive for everyone. (We also recommend people CW political posts, but we will not mandate it.)

  2. All users, local and remote, will be considered in the wrong in a conversation that goes sour if they participate in the following:

    1. Microaggressions ("not all men", white/man/cis-splaining, using the wrong pronouns to address someone after being corrected, ableism, etc.)

    2. Demanding education on problematic behaviour from a non-admin/moderator

    3. Skirting the lines of being a troll, or directly trolling

    4. Sharing DM screenshots or quotes from DMs or private communications publicly without all parties' permission

    5. Creating memes about someone without their permission

    6. Ranting or engaging in long rambling tangents on public timelines about a particular user without explicitly naming them (also known as "subtooting")

    7. Not tagging potentially sensitive or triggering toots

    This is not an exhaustive list, and all moderation decisions are ultimately left up to the discretion of our mod team. If any of these don't make sense, please speak with an admin or moderator. We are more than happy to help you understand the problems with these kinds of behaviours.

  3. The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline:

    1. Advertising and spam (does not include sharing links to your art-related income sites!

    2. Unapproved news bots, post bots or follow bots

    3. Untagged/non-content-warned NSFW content

    4. Pornographic or sexually explicit imagery that isn't tagged/content-warned

    5. Untagged/non-content-warned gore and extremely graphic violence

  4. The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline, and may result in account suspension and revocation of access to the service (please also note that bytetower.social does not allow those known for harassing marginalised people off-platform to have an account on this instance):

    1. Racism or advocation of racism

    2. Sexism or advocation of sexism

    3. Discrimination against gender and sexual minorities, or advocation thereof

    4. Ableism; discrimination against those who are neurodivergent, physically disabled, or mentally ill; fatmisia

    5. Xenophobia and/or violent nationalism, or advocation thereof

  5. The following types of content are explicitly disallowed and will result in revocation of access to the service:

    1. Sexual depictions of minors, real or fictional

    2. Content illegal in Germany and/or France, such as holocaust denial or Nazi symbolism

    3. Conduct promoting the ideology of National Socialism

  6. bytetower.social has a zero-tolerance mandate for harassment or bullying ‚Äî your account will be immediately suspended.

  7. Any conduct intended to stalk or harass other users, impede other users from using the service, degrade the performance of the service, or incite others to perform any of the aforementioned actions, is also disallowed and subject to punishment up to and including revocation of access to the service. This includes, but is not limited to, the following behaviors:

    1. Continuing to engage in conversation with a user that has specifically requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist may be considered harassment, regardless of platform-specific privacy tools employed.

    2. Aggregating, posting, and/or disseminating a person's demographic, personal, or private data without express permission (informally called "doxing") will be considered harassment.

    3. Inciting users to engage another user in continued interaction or discussion after a user has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist (informally called "brigading" or "dogpiling") may be considered harassment.

  8. Please do not flood the local timeline. We define "flooding" as posting three or more times per five minutes to the local/public timeline (but the definition is flexible; judgements on what is "flooding" or not will be made in context). Flooding drowns out other users and annoys instances we federate with.
    • You can reply to the toots of others and banter back and forth as much as you want, as replies aren't shown on the local/public timelines.
    • Please avoid posting many pieces of art/media all at once. Sticking to one post per ten minutes (with one-four pictures attached) is a good baseline to follow. Please respect others' content and statuses so that they can discover other artists in the local timeline.
    • If you'd like to post long threads of many toots, consider marking the first toot as "public", and the rest in replies marked as "unlisted". This will allow users to click through the first toot to read the rest of the thread without flooding the local/public timelines.

  9. Regarding nudity/NSFW content:

    It's considered good form to put nudity behind a CW as a courtesy for other users in the fediverse at large, and we encourage this practice. Recognizing the subjectivity of the matter, we consider this a recommendation rather than a hard rule, and we will approach any reports or complaints on a case-by-case basis.

     <ul><li>Illustrative nudity and body/anatomy studies with very visible genitalia, and titillating / erotic imagery intended for mature audiences  are allowed on bytetower.social, but <strong>only</strong> if tagged appropriately (ex. #NSFW, #nudity, #lewd, etc.) and marked as sensitive or placed under a descriptive content warning.
   <ul><li>Tags are required so people have the opportunity to filter such content from their timelines altogether.</li>
   <li>Descriptive text is required so that people can make an informed decision about whether to engage with the content below the cut/image blur or not.</li>
    <li>If you're unsure whether to mark a work as sensitive or post it under a Content Warning, consider the following hypothetical questions: Is it something you'd be comfortable viewing in a white collar work situation? Is it something you'd be comfortable being viewed by a minor? Would you happily show it to your parents? A no to any of these questions may require it being CWed/marked as sensitive. If you're still unsure, marking it as sensitive/CWing it is a good bet.
    </li><li>Another way to decide whether to mark a work as sensitive or post it under a Content Warning is to remember the <strong>Three B's</strong>: If your work features any <strong>B</strong>oobs, <strong>B</strong>utts, or <strong>B</strong>its (genitals), hide that sucker!</li>
   </ul>
   </li>

info.full_description:
Tiggi.es is an instance dedicated to tech, gaming, automotive, maker, body positive LGBTQ+/BIPOC folks from all over. We believe in providing a reliable, safe place for discussions on the Fediverse, while protecting our users from tools on Gab and Truth Social.

As folks on the Fediverse may not be accustomed to instances run by individuals, here is how Tiggi.es is set up:

Tiggi.es is located in northern Austin, TX on a 3 node HA (high availability) replica cluster on Intel Enterprise-grade SSDs (D3-S4510). Boot drive is 2 WD SN700 NVMe 1TB drives in RAID-Z1 Its cluster data is synced every 10 minutes between 2 systems with Intel i7-12700t processors and 1 with an Intel i9-10900t with 64GB of DDR5 (DDR4 for the i9) per node. The Virtual Environment is by ProxMox, with Enterprise Level update support. The system is on a dedicated 30a circuit backed by UPS and 24kw whole building natural gas generator. Soon, solar will be added. Data is backed up to a RAID-6 array nightly and backed up to LTO6 tape weekly. Tapes are cycled off-site every 3 months. Our connection is a business class fiber 5Gbit symmetrical account with multiple static IPs through AT&T.

What this means is, if one of our servers dies, we lose a max of 10 minutes of data. And the site is back up on another server within 10 seconds. Your data is always backed-up, and barring planned downtime or upstream things out of our control, you will have a fast, reliable experience with tiggi.es. The fact that we limit our users makes that even more beneficial. When choosing an instance, please choose one that is open about their configuration and how they secure your data and maintain a high uptime.

Donations: Please donate to your nearest animal shelter and post it. Helping real animals means more to us than helping pay for the setup. Thank you.

Data Security: Tiggi.es considers security and privacy to be of paramount importance. In the event of any legal inquiry, Tiggi.es will require appropriate legal documents in order to share any data we have. None of our data is stored on the cloud, or on systems not owned by Tiggi.es. While there are references to remote instances and private messages stored, we trust no 3rd parties with your data.

This is a queer-friendly federated Mastodon instance. You may use it as a personal account, and jokes are definitely encouraged, but the focus is on academics.

Real names and credentials are encouraged so that everyone is clear about who is talking and where they are coming from; however, we understand that publicly posting with real names is less safe for some scholars than others, and so they are not required. IN GENERAL, this server is governed by norms (standards of behaviour which we want to uphold, and hold each other accountable for) rather than rules (requirements which are enforced with the threat of punishment).

If you are new to Mastodon, you may find this guide useful. You can also find more in-depth information on the Fediverse at joinfediverse.wiki.

Encouraged uses of this server:

  • Brag about your publications
  • Share references and resources
  • Network with other academics
  • Put it on the last slide of your conference presentation
  • Recruit participants for academic surveys‚Äîformal, IRB-approved ones or even informal ones (just make sure to CW them so that others can consent and don't get too obnoxious about it; see the full Terms of Service for details about other research on members)
  • Satire and activism are welcome here, but they must make a good-faith effort to punch up. ("Punching up": making jokes or criticism at the expense of those with more power, higher status or greater privilege.)
  • Non-academic, "off-topic" stuff is allowed, and even encouraged. However, if you need to be told that proselytisation is not appropriate, then this is probably not the server for you.

Who is welcome on this server? Do I need to be a full-time student, teacher or researcher?

The "topic" for this instance is the academic study of religion, broadly construed. You do not need an advanced degree to join (or any degree, for that matter).

If you consider yourself a scholar of religion in any capacity, and you are willing to engage with others respectfully, and you will respect our community's efforts to make this a safe space for queer people and other minorities, you are absolutely welcome here.

This instance was specifically started to provide a safe space for minorities in academia. Due to the antagonistic relationship that law enforcement has often had with these groups, police officers and employees of any law enforcement or intelligence agency are not welcome on this instance.

Institutional Accounts

As Mastodon grows, more institutions, learned societies, research projects, and publications are seeking a home. We recognise that there is a large difference in the budgetary and technical capabilities of various entities, and that self-hosting is not an option for everyone. We will review requests for these accounts on a case-by-case basis, and are more likely to approve accounts for smaller learned societies and research projects where the timescale and budget make self-hosting impractical than for entire departments or societies large enough to employ their own staff.

In order to permit proper moderation, we do require assurance that each account will be run by a single, named individual rather than shared amongst a group. In order to minimise the demand such accounts make on server capacity, we request that they run primarily as announcement accounts. We do request that societies which choose to make this instance their permanent home consider a small donation to hosting costs.

This policy is subject to periodic review as Mastodon grows and changes. Owners of institutional accounts will be consulted in advance of any changes which would result in their use being restricted.

Introduce yourself!

After signing up, post a message to the Local Timeline telling us who you are, what your academic interests are, and helping us to get to know you better. Please tag your post with #introduction. It's also useful to tag it with #Religidon so that the wider community of religion scholars on Mastodon can see it.

Content Warnings (CW's)

Please add CW's (content warnings) that are accurate and descriptive enough to enable reader consent to the following types of posts:

  • rants,
  • selfies,
  • current events (includes: US or non-US, local, national, international, and should be applied regardless of whether sources are academic or non-partisan),
  • high-conflict or otherwise exhausting issues of popular debate (e.g. climate change, GMO's, privacy issues, elections, etc.),
  • mentions of death or violence,
  • references or links to Facebook/Twitter/other big tech companies,
  • spoilers of popular and recent TV shows or other media,
  • ASCII art (this one is important to ensure that someone using a screen reader doesn't have to listen to an attempt to read out a bunch of obscure symbols)
  • stresses particular to academia such as grades, exams, thesis progress, academic job market prospects, and
  • anything else where another user might want to decide for themselves whether or when they want to interact with your post.

In general, think of your posts not just as shouting out into the void, but as communication with real humans on the other side of the screen, and try to be considerate of those real humans. There is a setting in your preferences to open all posts with Content Warnings automatically, if you don't want to click through each one.

Image descriptions

It is a norm on this instance that you add accurate descriptions to all images and video that you post to aid in accessibility. (A description like "image.jpg" that does not aid in accessibility would not meet this expectation.)

If you post an image of a screenshot of text, it is a norm on this instance that you transcribe the text in the image description.

The Local Timeline

Posts on the Local Timeline (ones with the "Public" privacy setting) will be checked to ensure that Content Warnings are applied, images are described, and other norms are adhered to. Unlisted posts will not be proactively reviewed, but will still be subject to rules regarding abuse and other hate-speech.

NOTE: The "official" Mastodon app is NOT recommended for use on this instance, as it does not allow for posting using the "Unlisted" privacy setting.

Consider using a CW if you're not sure that your post is "on-topic." This instance is not meant to be a current events news aggregator, and if your post seems to fall into this category, you are likely to receive a gentle request to delete and re-draft it with a CW or as an Unlisted post. Let's try to avoid turning the Local Timeline into the same rehashing of the outrage-of-the-day that we see on Twitter!

Not every post on the Local Timeline should be CW'd, but most should. Do your best to try to accommodate each other, and try to be understanding when there is a clash of expectations or needs.

Unwelcome conduct

The following will result in: a warning from the admin or having offending posts deleted, possibly without prior notice, depending on the severity of the issue.

  • Providing unsolicited advice to strangers (see exception below)
  • Inappropriate un-CW'd posts on the Local Timeline (see above for CW policies)
  • Posts with un-described images or video
  • Shortened links, e.g. bit.ly, t.ly, tinyurl.com, goo.gl, ift.tt, lnkd.in, is.gd or t.co (These are considered malicious because link-shorteners track users without their consent and obscure the destination address, which also prevents users from being able to decide whether they want to visit the link beforehand)
  • Advertisement or apologia for cryptocurrencies, NFT's, or multi-level marketing schemes. (This is the one that's most likely to lead to summary deletion.)

Exceptions:

  • DOI links (e.g. https://doi.org/10.1136/bmj.k959) are allowed but the post must accurately describe the title/author/journal to allow the reader to decide for themselves whether they would like to follow the link. (In cases of very long titles, you may truncate it, and in cases of long author lists, "First-Author et al" will do.) Posts with DOI links where the target of the link is not described, or not described sufficiently, may be deleted without warning.
  • Unsolicited advice is allowed if its purpose is providing help to new users (e.g instructions on how to use CWs or image descriptions)

Things that will get your account closed, possibly without warning

These are the things that are not open to negotiation.

  • Racism, sexism, homophobia, transphobia, able-ism, etc. (will result in a permanent ban, you may not receive a prior warning)
  • Serious dishonesty that is hurtful to others (e.g. falsely representing oneself as a member of a minority; services offering to write academic papers to help students cheat; vaccine denialism; predatory conferences or journals; overt pseudoscience such as flat-earther-ism etc.)
  • Anything that could be described as "spam"
  • Impersonating other people
  • Harassment of any kind. This includes heckling, sea-lioning, and continuing to push a "robust debate" past the point that the other party has indicated that they are done.
  • No bots and no "institutional" accounts operated by non-members please; this instance is for people
  • Tools that repeat a Twitter account must post as Unlisted, not Public. Mirroring Twitter must not be the sole purpose of an account.

Regarding attempts to abuse these anti-abuse tools and policies

Do not attempt to weaponize our Community Standards or anti-abuse tools/policies against marginalized groups such as people of colour, women or queer people. Users are expected to have the literacy to understand that "reverse discrimination" is not real, and so attempts to re-centre discussions of marginalized people around the feelings of the privileged will be taken as manipulative behaviour undertaken deliberately in bad-faith. (E.g. white people should not demand that people of colour put CW's on every discussion of race; a straight person who reports a queer person for writing "I hate straight people" may find their own account suspended.) We recognise that the world is large, and there are indeed some contexts in which Christians do constitute a marginalised group, but Europe and North America are not among them.

More information may be found in our Terms of Service.

Welcome to Growers Social!

This server was primarily set up to be a home for all green thumbs. While we would love to welcome anyone with a green thumb hobby, we, unfortunately, will be limiting registrations for the time being to manual approval. Generally, this process takes less than 24 hours on a average day.

When attempting to register please list the reason you would like to join this specific instance that pertains to growing things.

E-mails may be delayed when registering, if need be try to resend them as needed. You might also check your spam box for these if they don't show in your inbox.

We tend to delay defederating with other servers as much as possible. We reserve this for truly horrific site content or spam that is harmful to our members or illegal in the United States. We leave the nitty gritty up to you to mute out as you choose.

We are a social group that is like-minded, don't feel as though all posts have to be about what you grow. Rather we want to create a small tight-knit community full of social interactions. In addition to grown items please feel free to share your daily life, interesting technologies, pets & animals, and anything that makes you, well you.

Code of Conduct

This document lays out the ground rules for participating in the growers.social community. It is intended to protect all members of our community from harassment and to ensure that our community is as welcoming and inclusive as possible. This is a working document, so the growers.social team may amend this CoC to better meet these goals in the future.

The following guidelines are not a legal document, and the final interpretation is up to the administration of growers.social; they are here to provide you with an insight into our content moderation policies:

  1. The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline:
    1. Excessive advertising
    2. Uncurated news bots posting from third-party news sources
    3. Untagged nudity, pornography, and sexually explicit content, including artistic depictions
    4. Untagged gore and extremely graphic violence, including artistic depictions
    5. Fake news, anti-vaccination spam
  2. The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline, and may result in account suspension and revocation of access to the service:
    1. Racism or advocation of racism
    2. Sexism or advocation of sexism
    3. Casteism or advocation of casteism
    4. Discrimination against gender and sexual minorities, or advocation thereof
    5. Xenophobic and/or violent nationalism
  3. The following types of content are explicitly disallowed and will result in revocation of access to the service:
    1. Sexual depictions of children
    2. Content illegal in the United States
    3. Any holocaust denial or Nazi symbolism
    4. Conduct promoting the ideology of National Socialism
  4. Any conduct intended to stalk or harass other users, impede other users from utilizing the service, degrade the performance of the service, harass other users, or incite other users to perform any of the aforementioned actions, is also disallowed, and subject to punishment up to and including revocation of access to the service. This includes, but is not limited to, the following behaviors:
    1. Continuing to engage in conversation with a user that has specifically requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist may be considered harassment, regardless of platform-specific privacy tools employed.
    2. Aggregating, posting, and/or disseminating a person‚Äôs demographic, personal, or private data without express permission (informally called doxing or dropping dox) may be considered harassment.
    3. Inciting users to engage another user in continued interaction or discussion after a user has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist (informally called brigading or dogpiling) may be considered harassment.

These provisions notwithstanding, the administration of the service reserves the right to revoke any user‚Äôs access permissions, at any time, for any reason, except as limited by law.

Goals

  • Provide a friendly, safe, and welcoming environment for everyone, regardless of the level of experience, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, disability, personal appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, age, religion, nationality, political affiliation, or other similar characteristics.
  • Create a supportive community, where people freely share their passions and are excited and positive about each other‚Äôs successes.
  • Provide a venue for casual conversations.

Non-Goals

While it‚Äôs important to know what growers.social is, it‚Äôs just as important to understand what we‚Äôre not. growers.social is not:

  • A free speech zone. growers.social is a community with specific ‚Äî and high ‚Äî standards of behavior. If you would like to exercise your full free speech rights, you can do so somewhere else; while on growers.social, you should agree to follow the community rules set out in this CoC.
  • An advocacy space. There are many important, controversial, and political issues; and advocating for what you believe is important. However, growers.social is not the place for that advocacy. Even correct views can violate our CoC.

Reporting Volations

If you notice a toot that violates this code of conduct, please report it. It is easy to assume that someone else has already reported a toot, but it is easy for everyone to feel that way and no one to report the toot.

Mastadon f√ºr die Pfalz

Von Lautern bis Lu, von Germersheim bis zum Donnersberg: Mastodon f√ºr die Pfalz, Pfalzliebhaber, Exilpf√§lzer, Neupf√§lzer, Altpf√§lzer, Jungpf√§lzer. Teil des globalen #Fediverse.

Im Aufbau

Diese Instanz befindet sich noch im Aufbau. Das bedeutet insbesondere, dass sich derzeit leider nur wenige lokale Inhalte finden. Nutzer mit Pfalzbezug sind herzlich eingeladen, das zu √§ndern!

Mastodon lebt von seinen Nutzern: Je voller es wird, desto interessanter wird es auch.

Kosten

Der Dienst wird kostenfrei, aber ohne Garantien, zur Verf√ºgung gestellt. Falls die Nutzerzahlen derart durch die Decke gehen sollten, dass es nicht mehr finanzierbar ist, k√∂nnen wir √ºber Spenden sprechen - derzeit ist das schlicht nicht erforderlich und es ist noch viel Luft nach oben.

Moderation

Die Regeln sind zu beachten; insbesondere sind keine rechtswidrigen Inhalte geduldet. Kommerzielle Beitr√§ge sind eindeutig zu kennzeichnen und vorab mit @maschinenraum zu kl√§ren.

Werbung

Der Dienst wird privat finanziert und dient nicht dazu, kostenfrei Werbung verbreiten zu k√∂nnen. Andererseits gibt es sicherlich Angebote, die lokal von Interesse sind. Bevor kommerziell werbende Beitr√§ge gepostet werden, bitte mit @maschinenraum in Kontakt treten. In geringem Ausma√ü, bei fairen Angeboten und niedriger Werbefrequenz wird das in Ordnung gehen.

Diskussionskultur

Es wird Wert darauf gelegt, dass Beitr√§ge von pfalz.social - Nutzern konstruktiv bleiben und auf pers√∂nliche Angriffe verzichtet wird.

F√∂deration

pfalz.social ist Teil des globalen Fediverse-Netzwerkes. Die jeweiligen Instanzen haben teils sehr unterschiedliche Regeln, Umgangsformen und auch Rechtslagen.

Wir behalten uns vor, einzelne Nutzer anderer Instanzen oder auch ganze Instanzen bei uns in ihrer Sichtbarkeit zu beschr√§nken oder ganz zu sperren. Dies wird insbesondere bei rechtswidrigen Inhalten, Spam, Hassrede, Pornographie, etc. geschehen.

Eine Vorabmoderation kann prinzipbedingt nicht stattfinden. Wir sind daher darauf angewiesen, entsprechende Hinweise zu bekommen. Hierzu sollte die "Melden" - Funktion genutzt werden.

Bestandsgarantie

Falls der aktuelle Betreiber das Projekt aufgeben m√∂chte, wird zun√§chst ein neuer Betreiber gesucht, der das Projekt √ºbernimmt. Sollte dies nicht erfolgreich sein, werden Nutzer drei Monate Zeit bekommen, ihre Daten zu exportieren und zu einer anderen Instanz umzuziehen.

Weitergabe von Daten

Im Falle von grob rechtswidrigen Inhalten, insbesondere Drohungen, wird ggf. durch die Moderation Anzeige erstattet und die bekannten Daten den zust√§ndigen Beh√∂rden √ºbermittelt.

Es werden keine Daten verkauft. Die Speicherung erfolgt in Europ√§ischen Rechenzentren. Mit allen Dienstleistern sind entsprechende Auftragsdatenverarbeitungsvertr√§ge geschlossen worden.

Es wird darauf hingewiesen, dass Teile von pfalz.social auf der europ√§ischen Infrastruktur von US-Konzernen betrieben werden, die dem CLOUD-Act unterliegen. Wer also Inhalte teilt, die f√ºr die US-Regierung von so herausragendem Interesse sind, dass unsere Dienstleister zur kompromittierung unserer Infrastruktur gezwungen w√ºrden, sollte sich besser eine andere Instanz suchen.

E-Mail

Wir versenden grunds√§tzlich keine E-Mails an unsere Nutzer. Es gibt Ausnahmen:

  • Bei der Anmeldung zur Best√§tigung der Adresse
  • Zum Zur√ºcksetzen von Passw√∂rtern
  • Benachrichtigungen, die Du im eigenen Profil je nach Wunsch ein- oder ausschalten kannst.
  • Im Falle von wichtigen Vorkommnissen, √ºber die wir Dich benachrichten m√ºssten. (Beispiel: Einstellung des Dienstes, Kompromittierung, etc.)
  • Lange inaktive Accounts werden von uns nach einiger Zeit gel√∂scht. Bevor dies geschieht, werden wir Dich hier√ºber per E-Mail mehrmals informieren.

Mit dem Empfang dieser Nachrichten erkl√§rst Du Dich beim Anmelden einverstanden.

Nicht-Aktive Konten

Konten, die lange nicht genutzt wurden, werden von uns automatisch gel√∂scht. Du wirst hier√ºber vorab informiert werden und hast die Chance, Dein Konto zu reaktivieren.

<h4 id="administration-and-moderation-will-be-handled-as-neutral-as-possible">1. Administration and Moderation will be handled as neutral as possible</h4>
<p>Reports and widespread information on specific instances (often known as <strong>bad actors</strong>) will be verified

Welcome to Squawk.Social!
This server is made with Bird/Avian/Gryphon furries in mind. But anyone is welcome!
info.full_description:
Squawk.social was built with the idea of allowing a "nest" for avians of all kinds! The nice part is you can still freely interact with other servers that have closed registrations, so you won't be missing out on anything or anyone.

Feel free to join and invite friends. If I close registration, that is only temporary and would only be because of a needed server upgrade or an absolute emergency. I do not plan on ever running ads, I want this server to be free to use and ad-free. If this server becomes too much of a financial burden, I might open optional donations, but I would REALLY prefer not to.

If you want custom emoji, shoot me a message! I can see about getting yours added in.

Please know, this server does allow NSFW content behind content warnings. As such, this server cannot accept users under the age of 18 years old to join.

Birbs Emoji set was kindly created by @cawsabit@furry.engineer

If you experience or observe unacceptable behavior, or have other concerns, please report it to someone responsible for the event as soon as possible.

You can find a list of contacts for this Code of Conduct at the bottom of the page.

In addition, the organizers are available to help community members liaise with local law enforcement officials, as well as otherwise reestablish their sense of security.

In the context of events with personal physical presence, the organizers will also provide accompaniment at the request of the person concerned.

Handling Complaints

If you feel wrongly or unfairly accused of violating this Code of Conduct, please contact a person responsible for the relevant event with a precise description of your complaint. Your complaint will then be dealt with in accordance with our existing policies.

Scope

We expect all community participants (paid or unpaid contributors, sponsors, and other guests) to adhere to this Code of Conduct in all community venues - online and offline - and in all face-to-face community interactions.

Report a violation

We try very hard to ensure that each of our events is an open and friendly place where everyone feels welcome and comfortable.

If you had an unpleasant experience with a participant, speaker or member of the organization at one of our events or in an online discussion about one of our events, then we are very sorry.

Talk to us

Please report this to the Code of Conduct Team (currently Sven) so we can make sure this doesn't happen again in the future. You can either contact us directly at an event or send us an email (also anonymously: anonbox.net): sven@svenbrier.de

We take every report and violation of the Code of Conduct very seriously and will speak to the person concerned and take appropriate action.

The Rules

By joining laserdisc.party, you agree to abide by our Code of Conduct. Spoiler alert: it's basically the same as the one over at toot.cafe, including their instance banlist (shout out to Nolan), supplimented by Dzuk's exhaustively-compiled banlist (shout out to Dzuk). We have a few little LP-specific additions, but overall, the short of it is this; don't be an asshole, use content warnings liberally (this includes spoilers, gore, sex, nudity, etc, but also workaday stuff like politics, mental health, and multi-toot posts), and for the love of God, be kind. If you can't do that, we'll have no choice but to bust out the banhammer. And if you think asking you to put sensitive content behind a CW is encroaching on your free speech, well, tough shit. Also, and I say this emphatically, if you're a Nazi, a bigot, a TERF, a SWERF, a crypto huckster or otherwise a hate-peddler? Take a hike. We don't need or want you here.

We also invite users of l.p to consider the user experience of everyone else here. It's not just a matter of etiquette, really. It's a matter of being just a decent person. It costs nuthin' to make stuff easier and more pleasant for others, so yes, CW liberally, add descriptions to images, camel-case hashtags with more than one word in 'em.

We want laserdisc.party to be a place for movie people, writers included. But if your account is all news aggregation and links to your website, I'm afraid you'll have to pitch your tent somewhere else. Plugging your stuff is cool, but it can't be all you do.

Again, laserdisc.party is a place for movie people. You can toot about anything (within the rules, natch), but we'd like this place to be a "movie-flavoured general instance," if you will.

If you have any questions problems (harassment troubles, clarifications, movie recs) get a hold of Derek. He'll help you out.

Any rebroadcast, reproduction, or other use of the toots and media on this instance without the express written consent of the laserdisc.party user in question is prohibited.

Mascot art by u/Nocut12

More Specific Rules, via mastodon.social

The following guidelines are not a legal document, and final interpretation is up to the administration of laserdisc.party; they are here to provide you with an insight into our content moderation policies:

  1. The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline:
    • Excessive advertising
    • Uncurated news bots posting from third-party news sources
    • Untagged nudity, pornography and sexually explicit content, including artistic depictions
    • Untagged gore and extremely graphic violence, including artistic depictions
  2. The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline, and may result in account suspension and revocation of access to the service:
    • Racism or advocation of racism

    • Discrimination against gender and sexual minorities, or advocation thereof
    • Xenophobic and/or violent nationalism
  3. The following types of content are explicitly disallowed and will result in revocation of access to the service:
    • Sexual depictions of children
    • Content illegal in Germany and/or France, such as holocaust denial or Nazi symbolism

  4. Any conduct intended to stalk or harass other users, or to impede other users from utilizing the service, or to degrade the performance of the service, or to harass other users, or to incite other users to perform any of the aforementioned actions, is also disallowed, and subject to punishment up to and including revocation of access to the service. This includes, but is not limited to, the following behaviors:
    • Continuing to engage in conversation with a user that has specifically has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist may be considered harassment, regardless of platform-specific privacy tools employed.
    • Aggregating, posting, and/or disseminating a person's demographic, personal, or private data without express permission (informally called doxing or dropping dox) may be considered harassment.
    • Inciting users to engage another user in continued interaction or discussion after a user has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist (informally called brigading or dogpiling) may be considered harassment.

Welcome

Gladtech.social was started in October 2022 to create a place for people to go after the beloved technology-focused Mastodon instance, mastodon.technology, shut down. After using mastodon.technology myself for so long (and having a great time!), I felt like I should try to give something back to the Fediverse. So here it is, a new instance. I hope many kind and thoughtful people on the internet will find a new home here.

- Jeff

Audience

This instance is aimed at the general technology crowd. Topics often discussed here often include software, hardware, firmware, shareware... Anything ending in -ware, really. Feel free to talk about $DAY_JOB, weekend hobbies, and anything in between.

If you're looking for more focus than all of technology (I know, right?), then feel free to pay attention to online privacy and open source software in particular. That's where the instance name comes from. AdTech and the larger ecosystem of surveillance capitalism and the attention economy are a pox on all our houses. GladTech represents a kind of response to that pox. An antibody, if you will. Don't contribute to AdTech. Instead, contribute to software that makes people glad. Contribute to GladTech.

Don't feel like you need to limit discussions to tech topics only though. Everyone needs a break from that now and then. Really, anyone who is willing to abide by the rules of conduct is welcome here, and their conversations are welcome too. If you're looking for non-tech ideas, pictures of cats are almost always welcome! #caturday

Customizations

Gladtech.social uses a customized version of Mastodon!

For now, I've only made a few minor tweaks:

  • Toots can be up to 2048 characters in length. Because powers of two are awesome!
  • The "Publish" button has been renamed back to "Toot", because we all deserve a little whimsy in our lives.

But in the future, I might get a little more ambitious. I'm thinking about adding encryption to the DMs someday. But I'm not quite ready for that yet.

Anyway, all the customizations for this instance can be found on the Codeberg account:
https://codeberg.org/cuchazinteractive/Mastodon

Sustainability

AKA: Will this instance still be around X years from now?

Predicting the future is hard, but here's some more information. Maybe that will help.

Renting cloud resources to run the instance costs money, and Mastodon uses a lot of resources apparently. The last time this section was updated (Dec 2022), the server had about 30 active users and a monthly cost of about 27/mo USD. The instance is running on a small self-managed virtual private server (VPS) at the moment. It's about the least expensive way I can think to do it. At this level of cost, I'm happy to keep funding maintenance costs out-of-pocket. It costs about as much as a couple TV channel subscriptions. Consider it my donation to the fediverse.

Someday though, if enough members hang out here, I might not be able to keep paying the bill personally. I don't yet know how big of a bill it will take to tap me out or how long it will take for the instance to grow that big, if ever. If that ever happens though, I'll open up the instance for donations from members. I've seen that model work well in other places, so we can consider that here if the time comes.

Rules of Conduct

  • No advertising or excessive promotion.
  • No bots, unless they're cute, funny, or useful. Bots should avoid posting to the public timeline.
  • No pornography.
  • No gore or graphic violence.
  • Content that is borderline NSFW or could be construed as NSFW at a glance should be put behind a CW (Content Warning).
  • No racism.
  • No sexism.
  • No discrimination based on gender, sexual minority, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, religion (or lack thereof), or national origin.
  • No xenophobia, nationalism, casteism, or fascism; no sympathizing with or advocating for these things.
  • No sexual depictions of children.
  • No holocaust denialism, no Nazi symbolism, no promotion of National Socialism.
  • No stalking or harassment. In general, if someone asks you to stop interacting with them, then stop.
  • Stalking, harassment, hate speech, or doxing that is posted to other instances or on other social media platforms is still grounds for having your account terminated here.
  • No posting (or threatening to post) other people's personally identifying information ("doxing").
  • No unwelcome sexual attention.
  • No public or private oppressive language or actions.
  • No promotion of conspiracy theories (eg anti-vax, anti-mask, anti-COVID).
  • No unsolicited advice to strangers.
  • No advocating for, or encouraging, any of the above behaviour.
  • No other unethical conduct.
  • No scraping content from web interface or API.

To protect the free speech of users belonging to marginalized groups, this instance does not federate with overtly fascist instances. Additionally, we will refuse to federate with instances that themselves choose to federate with fascist instances.

Our rules of conduct and instance block lists were forked from mastodon.technology, so a huge thanks to Ash and the moderation team there for sharing their great work with everyone!

Handling harassment

If you are being harassed, please report the user using the "‚Ä¶" button and then "Report."

If you engage in harassing behavior, the moderator may take any action they deem appropriate, such as a warning or an expulsion.

The above rules may change at any time, and you may be banned at any time based on the moderators' judgment.

Privacy policy

What will we do with your data? Nothing. How will you be influenced by advertisers? You won't. How will we aggregate your data in order to improve your service‚Ä¶ none of that.

We will never share your data with anyone else, except in the case of valid legal requests, if it comes to that. (Hopefully it won't come to that!) Similarly, users and third parties are forbidden from scraping content from the instance's web interface or API; you are required to respect robots.txt files.

More privacy information about this instance:

  • HTTPS is used everywhere thanks to Let's Encrypt.
  • No ads or trackers.
  • Links are direct URLs rather than tracking redirects.
  • Understand though that this instance is run by a human administrator (Jeff), and (as is the case with all Mastodon servers) that administrator potentially has access to your data, including DMs. The back-end is also not encrypted. If this is not okay with you, this might not be the instance for you.

Also understand that Mastodon has no real privacy guarantees. Specifically, Mastodon does not offer end-to-end encryption (E2EE). Mastodon is only really designed for communication in "the public square". If, instead, you want to have private conversations, consider using an app with stronger privacy guarantees, like Signal.

info.full_description:
A specialised mastodon instance just for pets. When you apply join please say what pet(s) you want to run accounts for. I don't allow human accounts. If you get rejected or don't get accepted quickly please check your email for a message with subject 'fluffy.family'.

I advise you read this if you're posting on here or the fediverse in general. It's a fun place, but be aware what you're getting into. I do my best to defederate from harmful instances, but I'm just a guy. https://blog.bloonface.com/2023/07/04/the-fediverse-is-a-privacy-nightmare/

Wecome to Australia‚Äôs Neurodiverse Community Instance.

This instance is not just for those that are neurodivergent but for any Australian that believes that all people should be treated equally. It can be used for whatever the community feels necessary, as long as the instance‚Äôs rules permit it.

**Each person using this instance is required to be able to manage their own triggers, as this is connected to the Fediverse, and other instances do not have to follow our instance‚Äôs rules.

This instance currently does not require donations as it‚Äôs running costs are being covered by the Admin (@stephen).

You are in safe hands

This server abides by the Mastodon Server Covenant

  1. Active moderation against racism, sexism, homophobia and transphobia Users must be confident that they are joining a safe space, free from white supremacy, antisemitism and transphobia of other platforms.

  2. Daily backups Users must be confident that a trip over the power cable or a rogue bit flip will not erase all of their data. Having a backup strategy is a basic necessity of providing a public service.

  3. At least one other person with emergency access to the server infrastructure Various circumstances can prevent the original owner of the Mastodon server from answering technical emergencies. For this reason, more than one person must have that capability.

  4. Commitment to give users at least three months of advance warning in case of shutting down Sometimes services shut down, and it is the cycle of life. But users must be confident that their account will not disappear overnight, so they have time to export their data and find another server.

Instance Rules

This instance intends to allow the neurodiverse community a safe, inclusive and judgement-free environment to unmask. To allow this to occur, some rules must be followed.

Be Friendly

  • The internet was designed to connect computers and the people that use them. Its role is no longer to launch nuclear weapons, but the computers and people idea is still there
  • Remember that the other computers you are communicating with are other humans. Their life may be less, the same, or more complex than you know. Treat them how you would like to be treated
  • Consider the reach of the posts you make. Tag content that you expect others might not want to see.
  • Harassment and bullying of any kind are not tolerated here. Do not engage with a user if they do not want you to. Do not ask other users to, either. If you feel a post generated on this server violates this rule, bring it to a moderator's attention.

No Baiting

  • Do not make posts to get angry reactions.
  • ‚ÄúI was being ironic‚Äù is a highly flimsy excuse for misbehaving.
  • Avoid sarcasm as it does not translate well in a web form, and even less for the neurodiverse who may not understand sarcasm
  • Do not drag unrelated people into a discussion

Follow the Law

  • This server is located in New South Wales, Australia. It and its users must obey all state and commonwealth laws
  • Do not share or distribute copyright material, pornography of any kind, personally protected information, and everything else illegal.

No Spam

  • Bots that interact with a user without a user's explicit permission are not permitted
  • Automated posting is not permitted without explicit admin permission.

No Commercial Accounts

  • Access to Neurodiversity-in.au is provided without requirement of payment to all individuals.
  • Commercial accounts are restricted to those that provide a service to the community and have been approved by administrators.
  • Any commercial accounts must have been pre-approved by the administrators, or they will be suspended without notice.

Be aware of the nature of the network.

  • This website is part of a network of similar websites. Other websites may have different rules.
  • The local administration has little control over users of other websites. You can, however, block and mute them - the same as local users.
  • In egregious cases, remote users or entire groups of users may be blocked from interacting with users of this website.

Admin decisions are final.

  • The interpretation of these rules is up to the administration, and an admins decision overrides the rules.
  • ‚ÄúTechnically, I did not violate any rule‚Äù is a flimsy excuse for misbehaving.
  • The rules may be changed or amended when necessary without notice

These rules aim to ensure a safe and welcoming environment.

  • This goal guides rule enforcement.
  • Any enforcement action will generally be kept between those involved.
  • Try to self-moderate, but do not hesitate to involve an admin when necessary. There are presently two people with administrative access to the website, @stephen and @emichan. You can report rule violations via the report function or e-mail.

Code of Ethics

This site has adopted the UFoL Code of Ethics, which are as follows:

  • No hate speech, defined as any communication in speech, writing or behaviour that attacks or uses pejorative or discriminatory language concerning a protected characteristic, in other words, based on their age, disability, ethnicity, gender, pregnancy, religion, nationality, sex or sexuality.
  • No Calls to violence. Any individual is promoting violence towards any person or group.
  • No intentionally circumventing blocks, for example, by creating new accounts, even on a separate instance, with the intent of circumventing a ban/block.
  • No harassment. If a user explicitly asks you to disengage and you do not, explicit calls to dogpile will not be acceptable.
  • All bots must respect the #nobot tag and must post unlisted.
  • Posts intended for commercial advertisement must be posted with the #ad tag or unlisted. Nudity involving genitals, sexual acts, or pornography must be posted either unlisted, with a content warning, or both.

info.full_description:
Come be a Cheeseburger

(hamburgers and veggie burgers welcome as well) or just be yourself.

This server is open for anyone to sign up and have fun.

Server Features:

  • Running on the Mastodon-glitch fork

  • As Well As Mastodon v4.1.0

Post Character limit is increased to 1000 characters per post from the default 500!

Server Technical Info.

This server is self hosted by the admin(@bacon)

Current Server Specs:

  • 2 Ubuntu OS Virtual Machines hosted on a Proxmox Server

  • 4cpu's with 6GB RAM Per VM

  • 1gb fiber connection

  • Ability to scale up server with more resources as needed.

  • Daily Backups and Retention of multiple backup versions.

  • Server is on a battery backup

Extended Rules ¬∂

"Be excellent to each other" is easier said than done, and means different things to different people.

The following rules are a (non-exhaustive) list of behaviours that may lead to deletion of toots, silencing or suspension of accounts, at the descretion of the instance administrators, as described in our Terms.

Please report behaviour that bothers you. We will keep your report confidential.

  • We do not tolerate discriminatory behaviour and content promoting or advocating the oppression of members of marginalised groups. These groups may be characterised by any of the following (though this list is naturally incomplete):
    • ethnicity
    • gender identity or expression
    • sexual identity or expression
    • physical characteristics or age
    • disability or illness
    • nationality, residency, citizen status
    • wealth or education
    • religious affiliation, agnosticism or atheism
  • We do not tolerate threatening behaviour, stalking, and doxxing.
  • We do not tolerate harassment, including brigading, dogpiling, or any other form of contact with a user who has stated that they do not wish to be contacted.
  • We do not tolerate mobbing, including name-calling, intentional misgendering or deadnaming.
  • We do not tolerate violent nationalist propaganda, Nazi symbolism or promoting the ideology of National Socialism.
  • Actions intended to damage this instance or its performance may lead to immediate account suspension.
  • Content that is illegal in Germany will be deleted and may lead to immediate account suspension.

Best practices ¬∂

The list below is a collection of behaviour that we expect to see from our users. If you see a user go against these best practices in a way that bothers you, please file a report and we will talk to them. While these best practices are designed to be guidelines for a good communal instance, repeated malicious unwillingness to follow the best practices will be considered just like breaking a rule.

  • In general, use the tools provided to foster a considerate and accessible atmosphere. This includes the liberal use of content warnings (especially on potentially disturbing or controversial topics), and alt-text captioning of media files.
  • When possible, provide credit for creative works in your posts that are not your own.
  • Uninvited comments about another user's personal choices, lifestyle or family are strongly discouraged and may be considered harassment. Inappropriate sexual attention, comments about appearance and implication of physical contact will not be tolerated toward any non-consenting user.
  • If you post sexual content or gore, use content warnings.
  • If you post advertisements, use a content warning. Advertisements should not be excessive or automated.
  • Bots may only interact with a user when they're invited by that user to do so.
  • Automated posts and high-frequency posts should be unlisted (rendering visible to everybody, but not appearing on the local timeline) to keep the local timeline of our instance a place of community dialogue and human interaction. This extends to bots, feed posters, Twitter "retweets" and Twitter crossposts with broken mentions. Crossposter accounts that stop being active participants in our community may be removed at the discretion of the moderators.
  • In discussions, please remain civil, do not insult the people you're talking to. Note that irony, sarcasm, or similar modes of language don't translate well to written language and tend to escalate discussions or misunderstandings.
(These best practices were inspired by the Terms of bsd.network. Thank you!)

Resources ¬∂

You can find further information on our instance on our dedicated page, which includes a list of currently blocked or silenced instances.

We are maintaining this instance on our spare time, hardware and nerves. Don't push either of those.

Welcome to Pawsitiv Space's Social Space

Pawsitiv Space is founded on the principles of respect, inclusion, and positivity. These principles and the goals and standards of the community extend to this Social Space as well.

Posts can have up to 500 characters, be formatted with Markdown, Content Warnings, and up to 4 attachments with custom focal points for thumbnails, custom video thumbnails, and descriptions/alt-text for others. You can also edit or delete and re-draft your posts after publishing.

We aren't trying to sell you anything here, nor are we trying to sell you. Enjoy the content you want when you want it. You choose what you see!

You can learn more about using our Mastodon instance here.

Social Space Guidelines

In addition to following the Pawsitiv Space Code of Conduct, there are additional guidelines for our Social Space.

Restricted Content

We allow any content defined in the Code of Conduct Restricted Content section under the following guidelines:

  • Text is hidden behind a Content Warning
  • Media is marked as sensitive with a description or Content Warning
  • The Content Warning or description used has:
    • An appropriate description of the hidden content so users can decide if they want to interact
    • Appropriate hashtags so users can automatically filter content they don't wish to see

Crossposting

"Crossposting" is the automatic copying of posts between platforms. This does not include posts made simultaneously from the same app to multiple platforms. Those posts would be considered original content and the following may not apply.

Crossposting from our Social Space to other platforms is fully permitted by us. Be aware, that the other platform may have guidelines regarding Crossposting. Crossposting from other platforms into our Social Space is only allowed under the following guidelines:

  • The posts do not include platform specific mentions or references, i.e talking about "here" referring to the other platform.
  • The Social Space account is at least semi-regularly monitored so that interactions on Mastodon are not ignored.
  • The accounts are both owned by the same person. Third party crossposting is not allowed.
  • Content from other accounts is not copied verbatim, i.e. quote tweets.

Multiple Accounts

You are allowed to have multiple accounts on our instance unless except for purposes that violate our Code of Conduct or other guidelines or for ban, suspension, or block evading.

Reporting Violations

To report a post on Mastodon, you can click the 3-dot menu button on a post and select report. From there, you can select the reason for the report along with additional posts to include. Next, you can specify more details for the report. Please include any details you think may help a moderator understand and make a decision about your report.

If the report is against a user from another instance, you'll also have the option to forward an anonymized copy of the report to that other instance. You should only do this if the post also violates that instances rules.

You may also follow any of the methods outlined in the Code of Conduct.

DMCA Complaints

For DMCA Complaints, you can find more information on our DMCA Information page.

info.full_description:
About this server

This is a Norwegian mastodon instance and safe haven for social exchange between tech people from the University of Oslo, Norway. Despite that, this site has no affiliation nor it belongs to the University of Oslo.

It is also opened for other tech people and/or friends from around the world, but we have restrictions to posts in other languages (check our rules).

The name "babb" is because of the love for good kebabs that we share at USIT (University Center for Information Technology at the University of Oslo. On our team, we call them affectionally "babb".

It came to us that "babbe" is used pejoratively for immigrants in Sweden - which is kinda ironic, since the admin of this site has indeed and proudly, a foreign background.

Mastodon.oslo.no

All of our users can either identify themselves as @user@babb.no, @user@mastodon.babb.no and @user@mastodon.oslo.no.

Mastodon Server Covenant

We adhere 100% to the Mastodon Server Covenant. No racism, gender discrimination or anti-semitism will be tolerated.

We have daily backups, and @Gaelle has also access to the server infrastructure in case of emergency.

Transparency

This server runs on a kubernetes cluster with 6 nodes, 3 masters and 3 workers. Each machine has 14gb ram, but we might upgrade them accordingly should there be need for that.

Relays

We joined the following relays:

  • https://relay.babb.be - a relay for Norwegian instances
  • https://relay.intahnet.co.uk
  • https://relay.berserker.town
  • https://relay.instancias-br.online
  • https://relay.beckmeyer.us

Contact

If you need to contact us, send us an e-mail or a toot to @admin.

Blocked servers/instances

We are replicating blocked instances from mastodon.social.

info.full_description:
@PostPandemicParty.org

‚ÄúI am in the world to change the world.‚Äù ‚ÄîKathe Kollwitz

This is a home base for relatively like-minded folks to land in the #TwitterMigration. Likeminded, how? In the middle of 2020, the world ground to a halt and was turned on its head. At that point, many were ready to admit that the systems running our world ==> are systems running humans (and this planet) into the ground. If you had that moment of reflection, the PostPandemicParty might be the homebase for you to land in.

If can see that the society you live in was formed in the image of white supremacy, and is still steeped in it, then this might be the homebase for you.

If you believe a multi-racial/multi-ethnic democracy is ‚Äòa more perfect union‚Äô that we were dedicated to form (and that this is possible), that #BlackLivesMatter, that you're standing on #NativeLand, then this might be the homebase for you.

If you believe in liberation more than charity or philanthropy, and would support oppressed people to lead the way to achieve their liberation, then this might be for you.

If you're sick and tired of [racism, settler colonialism, misogyny, religious extremism, homophobia, transphobia, nationalism, anti-semitism, xenophobia], and of being sick & tired, this might be the place for you.

If you try to leave a better planet than you inherited, even if you know that the institution/corporation/academy where you work is steeped in a history of these oppressions, this might be for you.

If you're a human who believes in things like the above but also sometimes makes a human mistake, has messed up on a person's pronouns or said something ableist and apologized, or been called-in for an implicit bias you never examined before... and you are OK with becoming a better person and self-aware enough to learn from experiences, you might be home.

If you grapple with these contradictions, because the human condition is messy, welcome.

*It's not coincidence that we quote a Black woman and scholar above: BIPOC folks are listened to, uplifted in, and leaders of this Party.

On this instance you might find professors, scholars, educators, digital humanists, human rights lawyers, ethicists, feminists, cartographers, designers, feminist cartographers and designers, archivists, librarians, poets, artists, activists, artist-activists, creative coders, public historians, museum professionals, organizers, journalists, archeologists, and a hundred other careers that people can hold. They might post about their projects, they might post links, they might post cute dog pics/cat pics/chinchilla pics, or they might post about a heck of a day they are having. There's no suggested "on-topic".

Rationale

The #TwitterMigration won't happen all at once; it might ebb and flow as the tenor of Twitter degrades over time. Or maybe, it won't be as big an exodus as we thought. This instance was set up in October 2022 to be operational in case/when people find the need to move some of their energies off that corporate platform.

Also, one doesn't need to move their life wholesale off Twitter. It's possible to still tweet at/keep tabs on the Trending Topics & politicians & institutions of the world, while deciding that your personal posts (and quest for community) can be better served somewhere else.

There are several Mastodon instances geared towards people in tech (octodon.social, fosstodon.org, indieweb.social, hachyderm.io, tech.lgbt). Scholar.social caters to academics, but discourages people from posting about their personal lives. Weirder.earth might be one I would pick. Yet I could not find a Mastodon instance that seemed home to folks who are politicized by the corruption of our governing systems, who advocate for structural change, and in so doing are already practicing respect for the diversity of humans who show up to the table.

This instance is called a Party in the sense of a Big Tent that covers people no matter what their specific interests are (cooking, birding, aerial arts, tech, data viz, maps, genealogy, higher ed, whatever!). But parties form around a value system that its members want to see in the world. We want to foster a community here that starts from a set of shared values.

Quick Primer on Mastodon: You aren't just siloed on this community

Abridged from mastodon.help.

Mastodon is open-source software for letting microbloggers worldwide engage with each other, while being decentralized and noncommercial. Every instance has its own server, rules, admins, and moderation. So the social norms for posting vary locally across servers. The administrators on each instance are the ones who can block, mute or suspend accounts who violate their standards.

Your Mastodon username will be in the format of @username@Instance

It really doesn't matter what Instance you register on if you are OK by their posting rules.

You can still Follow, Boost (‚âàretweet), DM, and reply to people the world over, because these servers are federated on a common protocol. (Think of your Instance as the area code of your phone number; your number can still call anyone else in the world.) If you want to change Instances in the future, it is possible to transfer all your data including toots (‚âàtweets), followers and blocked users list.

However, there is one advantage within your Instance: Mastodon's UI provides a Local Timeline as well as your Federated Timeline. That means if you are embedded in a like-minded community, you are likely to discover interesting posts/conversations/links just within the Local feed, without the outside noise. Plus, the directory of users will be people you will probably find interesting. This also means that instances with 10K+ users are not necessarily BETTER ‚Äî at that point, the noise is back in your Local feed and is not really much different than the Federated Timeline. So small & medium-sized instances might actually be a better experience.

Mastodon's functionality is a lot like Twitter, but it is not the same. First, you get 500 characters, not 280. Second, your Feed is in chronological order; it is not manipulated by an algorithm. Mastodon has a Content Warning (CW) feature available with every post you make. It‚Äôs an optional mask that covers the content of your post with a warning message that you can customize.

on Twitteron Mastodonbut...
TweetToot
RetweetBoostbut you can't Quote Tweet
Quote Tweet‚ÄîTo add your 2¬¢ you have to reply into the author's thread. This was a Mastodon design decision to foster real discussions, less-so talking about someone else.
LikeFavourite (Star)but starring won't help it appear in your followers' feed
DMsDMshere it's really just a toot with the privacy set to 'Mentioned Person Only'. There's a separate tab for viewing them, but it's much less like an Inbox
Elon MuskNo one owns itit's open-source, and hence decentralized

Most importantly, Mastodon is NOT a direct Twitter-replacement. It's a social media platform to be home to its own discussions. You shouldn't use Mastodon just to echo/post the stuff that outrages you on Twitter, and you are not rewarded here for the number of Stars (‚âàlikes) or Boosts (‚âàretweets) you get. Just to know how many times a certain post was Boosted or favorited you must click on it; but there is no emphasis on it, and in fact, nobody really cares. Mastodon seems focused on having actual conversations about the topic you're posting about. See what other people reply, and add to your understanding of this crazy world we are in.

The following mindsets from Twitter do not translate well here: The emotional/social gratification in the # of retweets I get. Writing posts to get likes. Quote Tweeting to add my pile-on. What are the Trending Topics (imposing today‚Äôs obligatory pile-on)? Who should I follow?

Instead on Mastodon: Think ‚Äòwho would I interact with?‚Äô Write posts that are interesting, to stimulate discussion and interaction.

Finally, to be clear: never assume that there is 100% privacy in the Fediverse. Every Instance runs on a computer server, and the admins ultimately have the ability (even if not used) to examine everything stored on that server. If you think of your posts as a postcard you send through the digital mail, not a sealed envelope, then you should be okay. If you ever need true privacy, move your communications to another messaging platform like TXT, Signal, WhatApp, etc.

Server operations

This instance is hosted through Masto.host on a server located in France. For the time being, the time and cost of operation is being paid by auut studio to jumpstart this home. As the community size grows, we may implement a way for users to contribute $1 toward costs, and to create a shared governance for moderation. Remember, any site that you want to stick around for the long haul is something you will probably need to contribute to. ‚ÄòFree‚Äô services close shop all the time; or they are ‚Äòfree‚Äô because you are paying the corporation with ownership of your data.

The PostPandemicParty will federate with everything that doesn't support spam, hate speech, hateful ideology, negative or threatening behaviour, fascism and proto-fascism, extremism, or child pornography... we'll block all that shit to shield our users from hate. In short, we don't argue with people that Tubman would have shot.

We restrict the default visibility of posts coming from instances known for NSFW content, so that our users can use this instance at work. More information can be found in the section Moderated Servers below.

Server rules

Below is a summary of rules that govern the PostPandemicParty instance. You need to follow this if you want to have an account on this server:

  1. Come to this forum in a spirit of community ‚Äî to share your wisdom and unique talents, to make connections, to gather feedback, to learn from other people's wisdom and unique talents ‚Äî and you are 90% of the way there.
  2. On public timelines, a content warning (CW) or proper tagging is required for nudity and violence, and any historical racist imagery that you are analyzing or critiquing. CWs are recommended for anything commonly traumatic.
  3. Spamming with links and straight-up advertising your commercial services is not allowed. But feel free to share your projects and what you are excited to be working on!
  4. Do not harass anyone, participate in group harassment or pile-on of anyone on this instance, or otherwise engage in name-calling and personal attacks. If you are feeling antagonistic, take a breather and log off. Come back and critique ideas, but not the person. Posting or threatening to post other people‚Äôs personally identifying information (‚Äúdoxxing‚Äù) constitutes harassment. Unwelcome sexual attention (including sexualized comments or jokes) constitutes harassment.
  5. There's going to be zero tolerance for slurs or hateful language; racist, sexist, classist, homophobic, transphobic, ableist, or otherwise discriminatory jokes. You'll get banned. If deep in your heart you believe there are some people who deserve more human rights than others (√† la white supremacy, misogyny, misogynoir, anti-Blackness, anti-Semitism, nationalism, settler colonialism, settler colonialism in the name of Zionism, transphobia, ‚Äúpoor people are lazy‚Äù, ‚Äúsex workers are bad people‚Äù, or any other hateful ideology), go find another instance to express that and save us both the time.
  6. Automated tools (like bots) are allowed if they post less than ~once a week, and you are actively participating in the replies that people engage with it. Unmonitored bot accounts that post automatically are not acceptable.
  7. Direct employees or contractors for any of the following types of organizations are not welcome here: Police, Immigration enforcement, State Intelligence/Private investigation firms. Individuals working for such will be banned.

The server is small-scale and invite only. Its population is mostly interested in varying intersections of law, policy, technology and society, and includes a range of academics, civil society and journalists.

Although we are a closed server, we follow the criteria of the Mastodon server covenant.

  1. Active moderation against racism, sexism, homophobia and transphobia

  2. Daily backups

  3. At least one other person with emergency access to the server infrastructure

  4. Commitment to give users at least 3 months of advance warning in case of shutting down

We support the server through donations on LiberaPay. Denizens are suggested to donate ‚Ç¨20/year.

Initially, we thought the pun "There's No Cloud, There's Only Someone Else's Computer" is attributable to @fsfe@mastodon.social, who have used it for at least a decade, and put it on stickers and t-shirts. We have since received a competing claim from @gcluley@mastodon.green, who claims he came up with the pun and was using it in the media in 2013. Either way, we appreciate the phrase, encourage everyone too think about the material conditions of computing, and presume the joke is implicitly governed by a strong copyleft license, and you should too.

Automated Scraping

Only initiatives run by non-profit or public sector libraries desiged to preserve Internet content for the public interest, including specifically the Internet Archive and perma.cc and organisations with with highly similar goals, have permission from the administrator to archive the contents originating from someone.elses.computer. The administrator does not own the copyright over the contents of the posts from the users of someone.elses.computer, and this therefore cannot be considered as a copyright license.

Not-for-profit services that index users in the Fediverse are permitted to scrape someone.elses.computer or access its APIs and retain data for the sole purpose of increasing discoverability of its users.

Non-profit research projects may be permitted to scrape someone.elses.computer, but we require all studies to undertake local research ethics approaches (such as a REC or IRB submission) and research ethics documentation being submitted to the research institution in question must be submitted in advance for approval to mail at someone dot elses dot computer for such approval to be granted.

For clarity, all users of someone.elses.computer do not give any implicit consent, and express objection by default until specifically clarified otherwise, for research-based data processing operations.

General Info

The Howlr Social Networking Instance ("Howlr") exists to provide members of marginalized, niche, and alternative lifestyle communities a forum of discussion, socialization, and platform for action. Although we focus on the alternative, all beings with an inclusive mindset are welcome on Howlr. We aim to both give people the ability to speak freely about a number of topics, including controversial ones, as well as provide a safe-space free from harassment and unwelcome behavior.

History

Howlr was founded in 2021 by Naia ≈åkami as a safe haven for members of niche and marginalized communities. Following Elon Musk's purchase of Twitter and policy decisions made on the site as a result, @naia and many of her friends and acquaintances began using Howlr as a primary form of social media. In 2022, Howlr migrated from Pleroma to Mastodon (glitch edition).

Paravielfalt.zone ist eine Instanz f√ºr paraphile Menschen und alle, die sich wegen ihrer sexuellen Identit√§t aus der Gesellschaft ausgegrenzt f√ºhlen.

Wir glauben daran, dass sexuelle Pr√§ferenzen keine Aussage √ºber den Charakter einer Person machen und niemand wegen seiner Gef√ºhle ausgegrenzt oder verurteilt werden sollte. Verschiedene sexuelle Pr√§ferenzen und Paraphilien sind keine St√∂rung und kein Fehler, sondern Ausdruck der menschlichen Diversit√§t und Vielfalt ‚Äì Paravielfalt eben.

Das Ziel dieser Instanz ist es, einen Safe Space f√ºr respektvolle Debatten und gegenseitige Unterst√ºtzung zu bieten. Wir hei√üen Menschen aller sexuellen Identit√§ten willkommen, einschlie√ülich P√§dophile, Zoophile, Nekrophile, queere Menschen und Andere.

English Version

Paravielfalt.zone is an instance for paraphilic people and everyone who feels excluded from society because of their sexual identity.

We believe that sexual preferences do not make a statement about a person's character, and that no one should be excluded or judged because of their feelings. Different sexual preferences and paraphilias are not a disorder or a sickness, but an expression of human diversity. The German name for diversity is "Vielfalt" ‚Äì hence the name "Paravielfalt".
